etymology.description: Depicts human remains -> variant of 歹(歹) (dǎi, "bad") -> top component of 餐(餐) (cān, "meal")
etymology.interpretation: The character 歺(歺) (è, "variant of 歹") represents a variant form of 歹(歹), used primarily as a component in other characters, such as 餐(餐). In this context, it contributes to meanings associated with deterioration or decay.

examples.chinese: 他是个歺徒(他是個歺徒)，常为凶作乱(常為兇作亂)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gè ètú, cháng wèi xiōng zuò luàn.
examples.english: He is a bad person, always causing trouble.

examples.chinese: 他面露歺色(他面露歺色)，让人心惊(讓人心驚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā miàn lù è sè, ràng rén xīn jīng.
examples.english: He showed a ghastly expression that startled everyone.
